root.name: bezierVertex()
root.description: Specifies vertex coordinates for Bezier curves. Each call to bezierVertex() defines the position of two control points and one anchor point of a Bezier curve, adding a new segment to a line or shape. The first time bezierVertex() is used within a beginShape() call, it must be prefaced with a call to vertex() to set the first anchor point. This function must be used between beginShape() and endShape() can only be used with the drawing types POLYGON, LINE_LOOP, and LINE_STRIP. Using the 3D version of requires rendering with P3D or OPENGL (see the Environment reference for more information).
root.syntax: bezierVertex(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3) bezierVertex(x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, x3, y3, z3)

parameter.label: x1
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of 1st control point, either a float or int

parameter.label: y1
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of 1st control point, either a float or int

parameter.label: z1
parameter.description: The z-coordinate of 1st control point, either a float or int

parameter.label: x2
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of 2nd control point, either a float or int

parameter.label: y2
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of 2nd control point, either a float or int

parameter.label: z2
parameter.description: The z-coordinate of 2nd control point, either a float or int

parameter.label: x3
parameter.description: The x-coordinate of anchor point, either a float or int

parameter.label: y3
parameter.description: The y-coordinate of anchor point, either a float or int

parameter.label: z3
parameter.description: The z-coordinate of anchor point, either a float or int
